author: T Madhavan
text:
While the work on constructing an Urban Primary Health Centre in Haridaspuram in Chromepet is being expedited, Pallavaram Municipality has started building another primary health centre on Kulakkarai Street in Nemilichery.

P. Dhansingh, Pallavaram MLA, who laid the foundation stone last week, told The Hindu that the municipality has been sanctioned two urban primary health centres by the State Health and Family Welfare Department. The project is the outcome of National Urban Health Mission, he said. “As the sanction has been given, the municipality opened these primary health centres at rented buildings recently,” said KMR Nissar Ahmed, municipal chairman. The contractors have been told to complete the project in three months, after which UPHCs would be shifted to these buildings, said an official of Pallavaram Municipality.

While the new one on Kulakkarai Street is being constructed at a cost Rs. 42 lakh, the one at Haridaspuram will be constructed at Rs. 48 lakh. Officials said the National Urban Health Mission, based on key characteristics of the existing urban health delivery system proposes a broad framework for strengthening health services delivery through primary public health systems. The quality of the services provided will be constantly monitored for improvement, an official said.
title: Nemilichery to get PHC too
